dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.
dependencies.name: py-cython

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description:
A Python package for describing statistical models and for building
design matrices.
dependencies.name: py-patsy

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.
dependencies.name: py-pytest

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.
dependent_to.name: callflow

dependent_to.description:
GPTune is an autotuning framework that relies on multitask and transfer
learnings to help solve the underlying black-box optimization problem
using Bayesian optimization methodologies.
dependent_to.name: gptune

dependent_to.description:
AlpacaFarm is a simulator that enables research and development on
learning from feedback at a fraction of the usual cost, promoting
accessible research on instruction following and alignment.
dependent_to.name: py-alpaca-farm

dependent_to.description:
Anvi’o is a comprehensive platform that brings together many aspects of
today’s cutting-edge computational strategies of data-enabled
microbiology, including genomics, metagenomics, metatranscriptomics,
pangenomics, metapangenomics, phylogenomics, and microbial population
genetics in an integrated and easy-to-use fashion through extensive
interactive visualization capabilities.
dependent_to.name: py-anvio

dependent_to.description: Elephant is a package for analysis of electrophysiology data in Python
dependent_to.name: py-elephant

dependent_to.description: Python scripts to find enrichment of GO terms
dependent_to.name: py-goatools

dependent_to.description:
A distributed Hyperband implementation with lots of room for
improvement
dependent_to.name: py-hpbandster

dependent_to.description: Normalize intensities of images from various MRI modalities
dependent_to.name: py-intensity-normalization

dependent_to.description: MNE python project for MEG and EEG data analysis.
dependent_to.name: py-mne

dependent_to.description: An open-source toolkit for computational pathology and machine learning.
dependent_to.name: py-pathml

dependent_to.description:
phydms enables phylogenetic analyses using deep mutational scanning data
to inform the substitution models. It implements Experimentally informed
codon models (ExpCM) for phylogenetic inference and the detection of
biologically interesting selection.
dependent_to.name: py-phydms

dependent_to.description:
plotnine is an implementation of a grammar of graphics in Python, it is
based on ggplot2. The grammar allows users to compose plots by
explicitly mapping data to the visual objects that make up the plot.
dependent_to.name: py-plotnine

dependent_to.description: Sequence Elements Enrichment Analysis (SEER), python implementation
dependent_to.name: py-pyseer

dependent_to.description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.
dependent_to.name: py-scanpy

dependent_to.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.
dependent_to.name: py-seaborn

dependent_to.description:
Bioinformatics tools and a software library developed by the Oxford
Nanopore Technologies Applications group.
dependent_to.name: py-wub

description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy
name: py-statsmodels

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
